confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed by the blaze.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
The Hong Kong fire authority classified the incident as a 5â€‘stage fire and is conducting investigations.
